chip.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a long thin piece of potato cooked in oil
chip.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a thin flat round piece of food such as potato cooked in very hot oil and eaten cold
chip.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a small piece of silicon that has a set of complicated electrical connections on it and is used to store and process information in computers
chip.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: the age of the silicon chip
chip.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a small piece of wood, stone, metal etc that has been broken off something
chip.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Wood chips covered the floor of the workshop.
a chocolate chip cookie  (=one that contains small pieces of chocolate)
chip.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a small hole or mark on a plate, cup etc where a piece has broken off
chip.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: There’s a chip in this bowl.
chip.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a small flat coloured piece of plastic used in games such as poker or blackjack to represent a particular amount of money
chip.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a hit in golf, or a kick in football or rugby, that makes the ball go high into the air for a short distance
chip.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if you chip something, or if it chips, a small piece of it breaks off accidentally
chip.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Gary fell and chipped one of his front teeth.
He chipped a bone in his knee and was carried off the pitch.
The paint had chipped off the gate.
chip.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to remove something, especially something hard that is covering a surface, by hitting it with a tool so that small pieces break off
chip.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Archaeologists were carefully chipping away at the rock.
Chip out the plaster with a steel chisel.
chip.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to hit a golf ball or kick a football or a rugby ball so that it goes high into the air for a short distance
chip.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: United scored just before half-time when Adcock cleverly chipped the ball over the keeper.
chip.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to cut potatoes into thin pieces ready to be cooked in hot oil
chip.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to put a microchip in an animal, person, or thing to identify or give information about them
chip.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a small electronic device, used in a computer to store information, organize the computer’s operating system, run programs etc
chip.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Each chip can hold 100 times the information contained on a standard magnetic-stripe card.
chip.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Brokers will start bidding for chips in the company as soon as the London market opens.
